functions.description: Add a key-value pair to the Socless custom mapping table
The AWS Request integration enables users call any AWS API.

arguments.name: operation
arguments.description: The boto3 client operation you want to perform, e.g put_object

arguments.name: operation_parameters
arguments.description: Parameters for the operation. Required but can be empty dict for operations that don't take parameters

arguments.name: assume_role_config
arguments.description:
Configuration for the role to assume to perform the operation. See https://boto3.amazonaws.com/v1/documentation/api/latest/reference/services/sts.html#STS.Client.assume_role
for a full list of values. Common values include `RoleArn`, `RoleSessionName` and `ExternalId`

arguments.name: disable_pagination
arguments.description: Set to true to disable pagination

arguments.name: save_to_vault
arguments.description: Determines if to save the results to the SOCless vault if the results are too large for step functions

functions.description: This integration helps to cache, return and (optionally) re-map fields of data so that it can be used by other States. Choice states particularly benefit from this integration as
Simple Counter
Creates a new event in Socless using the socless_create_events api from the socless_python library

arguments.name: event_type
arguments.description: Human Readable Event name e.g 'Investigate Login'

arguments.name: details
arguments.description: List of dictionaries containing the event details

arguments.name: playbook
arguments.description: The name of the playbook to execute

arguments.name: dedup_keys
arguments.description: The keys to use to deduplicate the event

arguments.name: data_types
arguments.description: A mapping of what datatypes are contained in the event details

arguments.name: add_to_details
arguments.description: A dictionary containing additional keys to add to each details dict

functions.description: Make any HTTP request using the requests library.
This function is useful for testing things, feel free to modify
Get a value from the Socless Custom Mappings Table.
Set the Investigation ID to status.
Create a log file and upload it to SOCless logging bucket.
Update the dynamoDB table with slack user's usernames and slack_ids

arguments.name: slack_profile_key
arguments.description: name in user profile to use for cache mapping

functions.description: Check if user is in a particular slack channel.

arguments.name: user_id
arguments.description: user id of the user invoking the slash command

arguments.name: target_channel_id
arguments.description: the channel id to be checked if user is in

arguments.name: token
arguments.description: you can pass an alternate token via Jinja template in playbook.json (ssm, environment, etc)

functions.description: Create slack channel and invite any provided slack_ids.
Get a slack user's profile from their username or slack_id.
Add users to a channel. Requires a Slack User Token (Token_Type: xoxp)
Returns a list of all available channels in the workspace.
Send a Slack Message and store the message id for the message.
Send a Slack Message and store the message id for the message.
Send a dialog into Slack
Send a Slack message without expecting a response.
Set topic for a channel.
